other_tests.findings: Pathological examination revealed lymphoid aggregates comprising approximately 10% of marrow cellularity and increased interstitial lymphoid cells. Flow cytometry showed kappa light chainâ€“restricted B cells that expressed CD19 but not CD5, CD23, CD10, or CD103.
Prolonged partial-thromboplastin time that did not correct with mixing with normal plasma and remained prolonged after 2 hours; lupus anticoagulant detected.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Partial-thromboplastin time returned to normal after splenectomy.

other_tests.findings: Post-operative course showed hematocrit and hemoglobin levels returning to normal within 6 weeks; lactate dehydrogenase level remained high; haptoglobin low suggesting ongoing hemolysis; anticardiolipin IgM remained elevated.
other_tests.changes_over_time: 15 months after splenectomy, patient experienced recurrence of fatigue and anemia, with elevated IgM paraprotein and anticardiolipin antibody.

other_tests.procedure_name: CT-guided needle biopsy of retroperitoneal lymph node
